intro: Paralabatia portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican paralabatia, is a unique flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
